sentence.Network_en: Joseph watched a shady-looking bunch playing cards aboard a Mississippi steamer.
sentence.Network_cn: 约瑟夫看到一群可疑的人在密西西比河的一艘轮船上打牌。

sentence.Network_en: His eldest son Joseph carried on his father's traditions.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的长子约瑟夫继承了乃父的传统。

sentence.Network_en: Joseph made sure that he was never palmed off with inferior stuff.
sentence.Network_cn: 约瑟夫确保自己从不会被骗买一些次等原料。

means.word_mean: 1. leader of the Nez Perce in their retreat from United States troops (1840-1904)
2. (Old Testament) the 11th son of Jacob and one of the 12 patriarchs of Israel; Jacob gave Joseph a coat of many colors, which made his brothers jealous and they sold him into slavery in Egypt
3. (New Testament) husband of Mary and (in Christian belief) the foster father of Jesus
